page.title: 02STANDARD OF LIVING
page.content: We interviewed 60 people, 49 were born somewhere other than Malvern, and 11 were natives. Most lived in detatched or sem-detatched houses which they owned themselves. Twelve lived in bungalows eight in flats and two in terraced houses. Most people chose gas for heating and cooking. The average house had five or six rooms, but one house had fourteen rooms and another had only two. Almost everyone had a television and telephone. 15% had home computers and 25% had video recorders. The average family had three or fewer children and had dogs as pets. Almost half the people belonged to clubs or societies, but only seven belonged to charity organisations, and most visited pubs sometimes.
